DataElement.preferredName: Myocardial Infarction Patient Previous Year Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient has a personal medical history of myocardial infarction within the previous year.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Myocardial Infarction Patient Previous Year Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient having a personal medical history of myocardial infarction within the previous year.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed):Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring prior to something else.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of myocardial infarction or unstable angina within the past 12 months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had unstable angina or a myocardial infarction within the past six months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction, unstable angina or a history of CVA within the last six months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 12 months of the first date of Bevacizumab therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 12 months of the first date of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months of the first date of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months of registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of myocardial infarction, unstable angina or uncontrolled arrythmia within 3 months of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any of the following within 6 months prior to study registration: bypass surgery, stent placement, myocardial infarction, acute coronary syndrome/unstable angina, hospitalization for congestive heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months of today

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of acute coronary syndromes, including myocardial infarction and unstable angina, coronary angioplasty, or stenting within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months of the first date of Bevacizumab therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina or has she had a myocardial infarction within the past six months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of congestive heart failure, unstable angina or a myocardial infarction within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a myocardial infarction or unstable angina within 6 months prior to registration for this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had unstable angina within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior unstable angina or myocardial infarction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction within 12 months prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of prior myocardial infarction documented by elevated cardiac enzymes or persistent regional wall abnormalities on assessment of LV function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction within 6-12 months prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior Unstable angina?
